cards.name: Abrupt Duplication
cards.text:
Glitch {1} (Remove one [restriction] for each time you pay the glitch cost.)
Create a token that's a copy of target [noncreature] permanent [you control].

cards.name: Adaptive Troll
cards.text:
{G}: Tap Adaptive Troll. It gains indestructible until end of turn.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if Adaptive Troll was dealt lethal damage last turn, put a counter of your choice on it from among vigilance, deathtouch, reach, trample, and +1/+1.

cards.name: Adventuring Guildmage
cards.text:
Flying
As long as there are five or more different creature types among creatures you control, Adventuring Guildmage gets +1/+0 and has hexproof.

cards.name: Affluent Cetanthrope
cards.text:
Flash
If you would upgrade a creature you control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it instead.
{3}{U}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Affluent Cetanthrope and draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“You won't even make a scratch with a sword like that. Best leave before it notices you're trying to kill it.”
—Selvar, the Seeker
cards.name: Ancient Guardian
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that Ancient Guardian would deal to or be dealt by creatures with no counters on them.

cards.flavor:
“It's been around since the days of the old gods. Do you really think you'll be the one to slay it?”
—Laigda, stampede shepherd
cards.name: Ancient Wurm
cards.text: Ward {3}

changes: 2022-07-01 — Adventuring Gear has been replaced with , an Equipment for {2} that makes a Treasure on etb, gives equipped +1/+1, and has equip {2}.
cards.flavor:
“Equipment helps you delve dungeons. Dungeons give equipment. The hard part is getting started.”
—Vosh, the Champion
cards.name: Appropriated Gear

cards.flavor: Each of the Ensouled is magically bound to a familiar during their first incarnation. These sacred animals serve as teachers, guides, and in many cases lifelong friends.
cards.name: Archivist's Familiar
cards.text: Flying, prowess

cards.name: Arena Challenger
cards.text:
Whenever Arena Challenger deals damage to a creature, upgrade it. (Give it one of the listed counters it doesn't already have.)
• +1/+1
• First strike
• Prowess

cards.name: Arms Merchant
cards.text: When Arms Merchant enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

changes: 2022-07-01 — Quests now have specialized triggers instead of landfall. Quest trigger changed to "Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell", and its modes exile that spell as it resolves rather than exiling a card from your graveyard.
2023-10-01 — Updated wording to exile the spell instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves.
2023-10-01 — Updated the wording of cards that exile spells "as they resolve" to exile the spell "instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves."
2022-07-01 — New trigger: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell. Modes now exile that spell as it resolves rather than target from your graveyard.
cards.name: Awaken the SOURCE
cards.text:
(Add a quest counter as this enters. Sacrifice after 6.)
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand, add a quest counter.
2, 3, 4, 5 — Exile target instant or sorcery spell you control instead of putting it into your graveyard as it resolves. You may cast that card from exile until Awaken the SOURCE leaves the battlefield.
6 — Exile target instant or sorcery spell you control as it resolves. Until end of turn, you may cast cards exiled with Awaken the SOURCE without paying their mana costs.
​

cards.flavor: “Godmother Ilthiss sends her regards.”
cards.name: Backstab
cards.text: Target tapped creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Bag of Holding
cards.text:
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
{2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Bag of Holding: Return all cards exiled with Bag of Holding to their owner's hand.

cards.flavor: “Stabbed in the face? Nothing a good night's sleep can't cure.”
cards.name: Bed Rest
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each creature you control.

changes: 2022-07-01 — New trigger: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control.
cards.name: Bind the Great Evil
cards.text:
(Add a quest counter as this enters. Sacrifice after 4.)
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, add a quest counter.
1, 2 — Exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls until target creature you control leaves the battlefield.
3 — Each player may scry 1.
4 — Put all cards exiled with Bind the Great Evil into their owners' graveyards.

cards.flavor: “Some say glitch magic is too dangerous to dabble in. Just wait until they see what the power of the old gods can do.”
cards.name: Blessing of Immunity

Glitch {2} (Remove one [restriction] for each time you pay the glitch cost.)

cards.flavor:
“Can't you see? Revela's cheating! She doesn't belong here!”
—Selvar, the Seeker

cards.flavor: Egg: broken. SOURCE: freed. Maker: notified.

Sacrifice a permanent, then draw cards equal to its mana value.
You may put a permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield if its mana value is less than or equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.flavor:
“Every tactic has another that foils it. Almost as if some cosmic force wants us to play fair.”
—Lelin, the Wise

—Lelin, the Wise

Flying

cards.flavor: It is said that even centaurs can become Ensouled. The centaurs fervently deny such claims, and mercilessly hunt any among their kind who prove them right.

cards.flavor: “The Mukal are barbaric, orcs brutish, humans spineless, and elves cruel. Only we truly know how to wage war.”

cards.name: Collect the World Stones
cards.text:
(Add a quest counter as this enters. Sacrifice after 6.)
Whenever you cast a permanent spell, add a quest counter.
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 — Choose a color that hasn't been chosen. Search your library for a permanent card that's exactly that color, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle.
Exile Collect the World Stones. For the rest of the game, you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.
​

cards.flavor:

cards.name: Gambler's Tournament
cards.text:
(Add a quest counter as this enters. Sacrifice after 5.)
Whenever you cast a spell, add a quest counter.
1 — Discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
2, 3, 4 — Target opponent discards a card, then draws a card. If they discarded a card with greater mana value than each spell you control, remove a quest counter from Gambler's Tournament.
5 — Discard your hand, then draw seven cards.
